metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8143 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Samba 4.0.x before 4.0.24, 4.1.x before 4.1.16, and 4.2.x before 4.2rc4,when an Active Directory Domain Controller (AD DC) is configured, allowsremote authenticated users to set the LDB userAccountControlUF_SERVER_TRUST_ACCOUNT bit, and consequently gain privileges, byleveraging delegation of authority for user-account or computer-accountcreation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8143` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
libpam-winbind - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
libsmbclient - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
libwbclient0 - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
python-samba - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
registry-tools - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
samba - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
samba-common - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
samba-common-bin - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
samba-libs - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
samba-testsuite - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
smbclient - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
winbind - 2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu4').
